intro: Scalesia affinis subsp. affinis, commonly known as the Galápagos tree, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a large shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that are grouped in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the island's biodiversity. Scalesia affinis subsp. affinis is also notable for its role in seed dispersal by birds and its adaptation to the unique environmental conditions of the Galápagos.
